frame.name: FR_Proving
frame.definition: <def-root>An <fen>Persuader</fen> succeeds to establish the veracity of a <fen>Content</fen>, and to convince a potential <fen>Addressee</fen>. The proof is either verbal or performed through some action. <ex>Jan <t>proved</t> <fex name="Content"> that the evidence was inadmissable</fex>.</ex> <ex></ex> <asf>Relation to fndata-1.5</asf> : Results from the splitting of Reasoning into two frames, FR_Proving and <frframe>FR_Attempt_suasion.content</frframe>, based on whether the Content has effectively been shown to be true by the Persuader. Further, in FR_Proving, the proving is not necessarily verbal. The Support FE is not included, because it is not subcategorized by any of the LUs in this frame and can thus be recovered compositionnally. </def-root>

FE.name: Content
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Persuader</fen> wants the <fen>Addressee</fen> to entertain the <fen>Content</fen>, which can be a proposition to be believed.<ex>Jan <t>proved</t> <fex name="Content">that the evidence was inadmissable</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the physical entity in which the proof is conveyed.<ex><fex name="Medium">The report</fex> <t>proves</t> that the evidence was inadmissable.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Persuader
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Persuader</fen> presents the <fen>Content</fen> before the <fen>Addressee</fen>.<ex><fex name="Persuader">Jan</fex> <t>proved</t> that the evidence was inadmissable.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Addressee
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Addressee</fen> is the entity before whom the <fen>Persuader</fen> presents a <fen>Content</fen>. <ex>Jan <t>proved</t> <fex name="Addressee">to the court</fex> that the evidence was inadmissable.</ex></def-root>
